subject: Cybersecurity
title: The ILOVEYOU Worm: Love Letter from Hell
description: A quick win: understand The ILOVEYOU Worm: Love Letter from Hell.

hook.text: On May 4, 2000, millions of people opened an email that said 'I Love You.' It destroyed their files.

buildup.text: The ILOVEYOU worm was a VBScript that overwrote files and emailed itself to every Outlook contact.

discovery.text: It infected 45 million machines in 10 days, causing an estimated $10 billion in damage worldwide.

twist.text: The creator, Onel de Guzman from the Philippines, was never charged â€” his country had no cybercrime laws.

climax.text: ILOVEYOU forced countries worldwide to create cybercrime legislation.

punchline.text: A love letter caused $10 billion in damage.

quiz.question: Why was the ILOVEYOU worm creator never charged?
options: The Philippines had no cybercrime laws
